title: Solo Traveler Trail
tagline: Safe, social solo adventures in the Beacons
suitableFor: Active solo travellers aged 25-55 looking for a mix of outdoor adventure and social interaction. Confident hikers and those comfortable in a hostel environment will thrive.
notSuitableFor: Those seeking luxury accommodation, individuals with limited mobility, or those who dislike group activities and shared spaces.
packingEssentials: Hiking boots with good ankle support

stops.title: Gorge Walking with Black Mountain Adventure
stops.description: Explore the beautiful Waterfall Country by scrambling up a gorge, sliding down natural water slides, and jumping into pools. A fantastic way to get active and meet new people.

wetAlt.title: Craig y Nos Castle Tour
wetAlt.description: Explore the historic Craig y Nos Castle, learn about its history, and enjoy the beautiful architecture. A spooky and engaging experience, especially in wet weather.

budgetAlt.title: Explore Sgwd Gwladys Waterfall
budgetAlt.description: Hike to Sgwd Gwladys waterfall and admire the views.

stops.title: The Old White Horse Inn
stops.description: A traditional pub in Pontneddfechan serving hearty meals and local ales. A great place to refuel after gorge walking.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Pontneddfechan picnic area
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a picnic lunch by the river in the village.

stops.title: Caving with Adventure Britain
stops.description: Descend into the depths of the Black Mountains and explore a real cave system. Crawling, squeezing, and discovering underground wonders, all with expert guidance.

wetAlt.title: National Showcaves Centre
wetAlt.description: Visit the National Showcaves Centre at Dan-yr-Ogof, a larger showcave experience with multiple caves and dinosaur park.

budgetAlt.title: Explore Llanthony Priory
budgetAlt.description: Wander through the ruins of Llanthony Priory and explore the surrounding countryside.

stops.title: YHA Brecon Beacons
stops.description: A modern hostel with stunning views, located close to Pen y Fan. Perfect for solo travellers looking for a social atmosphere.

budgetAlt.title: Penstar Bunkhouse
budgetAlt.description: A basic but comfortable bunkhouse near Libanus, offering affordable accommodation.

stops.title: Hike Pen y Fan
stops.description: Climb the highest peak in South Wales for panoramic views of the Brecon Beacons. Choose from various routes depending on your fitness level.

wetAlt.title: Brecon Mountain Railway
wetAlt.description: Enjoy a scenic steam train ride through the Brecon Beacons National Park.

budgetAlt.title: Walk around Pontsticill Reservoir
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a scenic walk around the reservoir.

stops.title: The Nant Ddu Lodge Hotel
stops.description: A modern hotel and restaurant near Pen y Fan, with a varied menu and comfortable setting.
stops.travelToNext: 1 hour drive via A470 and A4059

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch near Pontsticill Reservoir
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a picnic lunch by the water.

stops.title: Mountain Biking at BikePark Wales
stops.description: Experience world-class mountain biking trails at BikePark Wales, catering to all skill levels. Hire a bike or bring your own and enjoy the adrenaline rush.

wetAlt.title: Visit Cyfarthfa Castle Museum & Art Gallery
wetAlt.description: Explore the exhibits at Cyfarthfa Castle Museum & Art Gallery

budgetAlt.title: Cycle the Taff Trail
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a leisurely cycle along the Taff Trail.

stops.title: Grawen Camping
stops.description: A campsite on the edge of Merthyr Tydfil. Perfect for people on a budget.

stops.title: Paddle Boarding at Llangorse Lake
stops.description: Enjoy the peaceful waters of Llangorse Lake on a paddle board, taking in the beautiful scenery. A relaxing and social activity.

wetAlt.title: Visit the nearby town of Brecon
wetAlt.description: Explore the town and its local shops.

budgetAlt.title: Walk along the Brecon and Monmouthshire Canal
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a scenic walk along the canal.

stops.title: Llangorse Lake Cafe
stops.description: A cafe located at Llangorse Lake, offering sandwiches, cakes and drinks. Enjoy the views from the outdoor seating area.

budgetAlt.title: Picnic by Llangorse Lake
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a packed lunch with lake views.

stops.title: Archery with Black Mountain Adventure
stops.description: Test your aim with archery at Black Mountain Adventure. Enjoy a session with expert guidance in a safe environment.

wetAlt.title: Craft Workshop in Hay-on-Wye
wetAlt.description: Participate in a local craft workshop.

budgetAlt.title: Explore Hay-on-Wye
budgetAlt.description: Browse the many bookshops in Hay-on-Wye.

stops.title: YHA Llanbedr
stops.description: Set in the Black Mountains, this hostel is remote with great views, close to Hay-on-Wye.

stops.title: Hike in the Black Mountains
stops.description: Explore the diverse landscape of the Black Mountains. Choose a trail based on your ability level.

wetAlt.title: Explore Hay-on-Wye
wetAlt.description: Browse the many bookshops in Hay-on-Wye.

budgetAlt.title: Walk along the Brecon and Monmouthshire Canal
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a scenic walk along the canal.

stops.title: The Bridge Inn
stops.description: A popular pub in Llangynidr, serving traditional pub food and local ales.
stops.travelToNext: Drive to next location or home.

budgetAlt.title: Picnic by the canal in Llangynidr
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a packed lunch by the canal.

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: Brecon Beacons weather can be unpredictable. Pack for all conditions, even in summer. Rain is common, especially in the hills.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic can be heavy on weekends and during school holidays, especially on the A470. Parking at Pen y Fan's Storey Arms is limited; arrive early or use the park-and-ride service from Brecon.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Book activities with Adventure Britain and Black Mountain Adventure in advance, especially during peak season. Hostel accommodation is also recommended to be booked in advance.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: A reasonable level of fitness is required for hiking and gorge walking. Caving requires some agility and comfort in confined spaces.
